data.title: Farewell Alarm’s World Guide
data.meta_description: How to Navigate: Click any country listed below to be directed to the featured page with travel advice and stories from that country. If the country you’ve chosen has no stories yet, and you’ve got…
data.text:
How to Navigate: Click any country listed below to be directed to the featured page with travel advice and stories from that country. If the country you’ve chosen has no stories yet, and you’ve got the experience to write one, please let us know and enjoy featured placement on our homepage!

Scroll down or just CTR+F and type your country.

How does it work: Each country below links to a featured page for that country where you will find any articles by Farewell Alarms’ writers about those countries.

How to be featured: We are looking for articles on the top destinations within each of these countries. Got one? Send it our way and we will publish it here on the Country Navigator so people will see it when they look up a country.

Are you a blogger who writes about one of these countries? Let us know and become one of our featured bloggers!

This page is meant to be a community effort. Do you have anything to add to any of the countries? Did we make any mistakes or miss something important? We are human, let us know in the comments below.

*Information has been collected from Wikipedia, Britannica, & Project Visa

A

🇦🇫 Afghanistan

Afghanistan, officially the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan, is a landlocked country located in South-Central Asia.

Language: Pashto, Dari • Capital: Kabul • Currency: Afghani (AFN)• Visa

🇦🇱 Albania

Albania, on Southeastern Europe’s Balkan Peninsula, is a small country with Adriatic and Ionian coastlines and an interior crossed by the Albanian Alps. The country has many castles and archaeological sites.

Language: Albanian • Capital: Tirana • Currency: Lek (ALL) • Visa

🇩🇿 Algeria

Algeria is a North African country with a Mediterranean coastline and a Saharan desert interior. Many empires have left legacies here, such as the ancient Roman ruins in seaside Tipaza.

Language: Arabic, Berber • Capital: Algiers • Currency: Dinar (DZD) • Visa

🇦🇩 Andorra

Andorra is a tiny, independent principality situated between France and Spain in the Pyrenees mountains. It’s known for its ski resorts and a tax-haven status that encourages duty-free shopping.

Language: Catalan • Capital: Andorra la Vella • Currency: Euro (EUR)• Visa

🇦🇴 Angola

Angola is a Southern African nation whose varied terrain encompasses tropical Atlantic beaches, a labyrinthine system of rivers and Sub-Saharan desert that extends across the border into Namibia.

Language: Portuguese • Capital: Luanda • Currency: Kwanza (AOA) • Visa

🇦🇬 Antigua and Barbuda

Antigua and Barbuda is an independent Commonwealth country comprising its 2 namesake islands and several smaller ones. Positioned where the Atlantic and Caribbean meet, it’s known for reef-lined beaches, rainforests, and resorts.

Language: English • Capital: St. John’s • Currency: East Caribbean dollar (XCD)• Visa

🇦🇷 Argentina

Argentina, officially the Argentine Republic, is a country located mostly in the southern half of South America.

Language: Spanish • Capital: Buenos Aires • Currency: Peso (ARS) • Visa

🇦🇲 Armenia

Armenia is a nation, and former Soviet republic, in the mountainous Caucasus region between Asia and Europe. Among the earliest Christian civilizations, it’s defined by religious sites.

Language: Armenian • Capital: Yerevan • Currency: Dram (AMD)• Visa

🇦🇺 Australia

Australia, officially the Commonwealth of Australia, is a sovereign country comprising the mainland of the Australian continent, the island of Tasmania, and numerous smaller islands.

Language: English • Capital: Canberra • Currency: Australian dollar (AUD)• Visa

🇦🇹 Austria

Austria, officially the Republic of Austria, is a country in Central Europe comprising nine federated states. Its capital, largest city and one of nine states is Vienna.

Language: German • Capital: Vienna • Currency: Euro(EUR)• Visa

🇦🇿 Azerbaijan

Azerbaijan, the nation and former Soviet republic, is bounded by the Caspian Sea and Caucasus Mountains, which span Asia and Europe. Its capital, Baku, is famed for its medieval walled Inner City.

Language: Azerbaijani • Capital: Baku • Currency: Manat (AZN)• Visa

B

🇧🇸 Bahamas

The Bahamas is a coral-based archipelago in the Atlantic Ocean. Its 700-plus islands and cays range from uninhabited to packed with resorts.

Language: English, Bahamian Creole • Capital: Nassau • Currency: Bahamian dollar (BSD), US dollar • Visa

🇧🇭 Bahrain

Bahrain, officially the Kingdom of Bahrain, is an island country in the Persian Gulf. The sovereign state comprises a small archipelago centered around Bahrain Island, situated between the Qatar peninsula and the north eastern coast of Saudi Arabia.

Language: Arabic, English • Capital: Manama • Currency: Bahraini dinar (BHD)• Visa

🇧🇩 Bangladesh

Bangladesh, to the east of India on the Bay of Bengal, is a South Asian country marked by lush greenery and many waterways. Its Padma (Ganges), Meghna and Jamuna rivers create fertile plains, and travel by boat is common.

Language: Bengali • Capital: Dhaka • Currency: Bangladeshi taka (BDT) • Visa

🇧🇧 Barbados

Barbados is an eastern Caribbean island and an independent British Commonwealth nation. Bridgetown, the capital, is a cruise-ship port with colonial buildings and Nidhe Israel, a synagogue founded in 1654.

Language: English, Bajan Creole • Capital: Bridgetown • Currency: Barbadian dollar (BBD)• Visa

🇧🇾 Belarus

Belarus, officially the Republic of Belarus, formerly known by its Russian name Byelorussia or Belorussia, is a landlocked country in Eastern Europe bordered by Russia to the northeast.

Language: Belarusian, Russiana • Capital: Minsk • Currency: Belarusian ruble (BYN)• Visa

🇧🇪 Belgium

Belgium, a country in Western Europe, is known for medieval towns, Renaissance architecture and as headquarters of the European Union and NATO.

Language: Dutch, French, German • Capital: Brussels • Currency: Euro (EUR)• Visa

🇧🇿 Belize

Belize is a nation on the eastern coast of Central America, with Caribbean Sea shorelines to the east and dense jungle to the west.

Language: English, Belizean Creole • Capital: Belmopan • Currency: Belize dollar (BZD) • Visa

🇧🇯 Benin

Benin, a French-speaking West African nation, is a birthplace of the vodun (or “voodoo”) religion and home to the former Dahomey Kingdom from circa 1600–1900.

Language: French, Fon, Dendi • Capital: Porto-Novoa • Currency: West African CFA franc (XOF) • Visa

🇧🇹 Bhutan

Bhutan, a Buddhist kingdom on the Himalayas’ eastern edge, is known for its monasteries, fortresses (or dzongs) and dramatic landscapes that range from subtropical plains to steep mountains and valleys.

Language: Dzongkha • Capital: Thimphu • Currency: Ngultrum (BTN)• Visa

🇧🇴 Bolivia

Bolivia is a country in central South America, with a varied terrain spanning Andes Mountains, the Atacama Desert and Amazon Basin rainforest.

Language: Spanish, Guarani, Aymara • Capital: Sucre, La Paz • Currency: Boliviano (BOB)• Visa

🇧🇦 Bosnia and Herzegovina

Bosnia and Herzegovina is a country on the Balkan Peninsula in southeastern Europe. Its countryside is home to medieval villages, rivers and lakes, plus the craggy Dinaric Alps.

Language: Bosnian, Serbian, Croatian • Capital: Sarajevo • Currency: Convertible mark (BAM) • Visa

🇧🇼 Botswana

Botswana, a landlocked country in Southern Africa, has a landscape defined by the Kalahari Desert and the Okavango Delta, which becomes a lush animal habitat during the seasonal floods.

Language: English, Setswana • Capital: Gaborone • Currency: Botswana pula (BWP)• Visa

🇧🇷 Brazil

Brazil, officially the Federative Republic of Brazil, is the largest country in both South America and Latin America.

Language: Portuguese • Capital: Brasília • Currency: Real (BRL)• Visa

🇧🇳 Brunei

Brunei is a tiny nation on the island of Borneo, in 2 distinct sections surrounded by Malaysia and the South China Sea. It’s known for its beaches and biodiverse rainforest, much of it protected within reserves.

Language: Malay, English • Capital: Bandar Seri Begawan • Currency: Brunei dollar (BND) • Visa

🇧🇬 Bulgaria

Bulgaria is a Balkan nation with diverse terrain encompassing the Black Sea coastline, a mountainous interior, and rivers, including the Danube.

Language: Bulgarian • Capital: Sofia • Currency: Lev (BGN) • Visa

🇧🇫 Burkina Faso

Burkina Faso is a landlocked country in West Africa. It covers an area of around 274,200 square kilometers and is surrounded by six countries.

Language: French, Mossi, Fula • Capital: Ouagadougou • Currency: West African CFA franc (XOF)• Visa

🇧🇮 Burundi

Burundi, officially the Republic of Burundi, is a landlocked country amid the African Great Lakes region where East Africa converge.

Language: Kirundi, French, English • Capital: Gitega • Currency: Burundian franc (BIF) • Visa

C

🇨🇻 Cape Verde

Cape Verde or Cabo Verde, officially the Republic of Cabo Verde, is an island country spanning an archipelago of 10 volcanic islands in the central Atlantic Ocean.

Language: Portuguese, Cape Verdean Creole • Capital: Praia • Currency: Cape Verdean escudo (CVE) • Visa

🇰🇭 Cambodia

Cambodia is a Southeast Asian nation whose landscape spans low-lying plains, the Mekong Delta, mountains and Gulf of Thailand coastline.

Language: Khmer, English, French • Capital: Phnom Penh • Currency: Riel (KHR) • Visa

🇨🇲 Cameroon

Cameroon, on the Gulf of Guinea, is a Central African country of varied terrain and wildlife.

Language: English, French, Cameroonian Pidgin • Capital: Yaoundé • Currency: Central African CFA franc (XAF)• Visa

🇨🇦 Canada

Canada is a country in the northern part of North America. Its ten provinces and three territories extend from the Atlantic to the Pacific and northward into the Arctic Ocean, covering 9.98 million square kilometers, making it the world’s second-largest country by total area.

Language: English, French • Capital: OTTAWA • Currency: Canadian dollar • Visa

🇨🇫 Central African Republic (CAR)

The Central African Republic is a landlocked country in Central Africa.

Language: French • Capital: Bangui• Currency: Central African CFA franc • Visa

🇹🇩 Chad

Chad, officially known as the Republic of Chad, is a landlocked country in north-central Africa.

Language: Arabic, French • Capital: N’Djamena • Currency: Central African CFA franc • Visa

🇨🇱 Chile

Chile is a long, narrow country stretching along South America’s western edge, with more than 6,000km of Pacific Ocean coastline. Santiago, its capital, sits in a valley surrounded by the Andes and Chilean Coast Range mountains.

Language: Spanish • Capital: Santiago• Currency: Chilean peso • Visa

🇨🇳 China

China, officially the People’s Republic of China, is a country in East Asia and the world’s most populous country, with a population of around 1.404 billion in 2017.

Language: Mandarin • Capital: Beijing• Currency: Chinese yuan • Visa

🇨🇴 Colombia

Colombia, officially the Republic of Colombia, is a country largely situated in the north of South America, with land, and territories in North America.

Language: Spanish • Capital: Bogota • Currency: Colombian peso • Visa

🇰🇲 Comoros

The Comoros is a volcanic archipelago off Africa’s east coast, in the warm Indian Ocean waters of the Mozambique Channel. The nation state’s largest island, Grande Comore (Ngazidja) is ringed by beaches and old lava from active Mt. Karthala volcano.

Language: Arabic, Comorian, French• Capital: Moroni • Currency: Comorian franc • Visa

🇨🇩 Democratic Republic of the Congo

The Democratic Republic of the Congo, also known as DR Congo, the DRC, DROC, Congo-Kinshasa, or simply the Congo, is a country located in Central Africa.

Language: French • Capital: Kinshasa • Currency: Congolese franc • Visa

🇨🇬 Republic of the Congo

The Republic of the Congo, also called Congo-Brazzaville, is a central African nation with rainforest reserves that are habitats for gorillas.

Language: French • Capital: Brazzaville • Currency: Central African CFA franc (XAF) • Visa

🇨🇷 Costa Rica

Costa Rica is a rugged, rainforested Central American country with coastlines on the Caribbean and Pacific.

Language: Spanish • Capital: San Jose • Currency: Costa Rican colón • Visa

🇨🇮 Cote d’Ivoire

Côte d’Ivoire is a West African country with beach resorts, rainforests, and a French-colonial legacy. Abidjan, on the Atlantic coast, is the country’s major urban center.

Language: French • Capital: Yamoussoukro • Currency: West African CFA franc (XOF) • Visa

🇭🇷 Croatia

Croatia, officially the Republic of Croatia, is a country at the crossroads of Central and Southeast Europe, on the Adriatic Sea.

Language: Croatian • Capital: Zagreb • Currency: Croatian kuna • Visa

🇨🇺 Cuba

Cuba, officially the Republic of Cuba, is a country comprising the island of Cuba as well as Isla de la Juventud and several minor archipelagos.

Language: Spanish • Capital: Havana • Currency: Cuban peso • Visa

🇨🇾 Cyprus

Cyprus, officially the Republic of Cyprus, is an island country in the Eastern Mediterranean and the third largest and third most populous island in the Mediterranean

Language: Greek, Turkish • Capital: Nicosia• Currency: Euro • Visa

🇨🇿 Czechia

The Czech Republic, also known by its short-form name, Czechia, is a country in Central Europe

Language: Czech, Slovak • Capital: Prague• Currency: Czech koruna • Visa

D

🇩🇰 Denmark

Denmark is a Scandinavian country comprising the Jutland Peninsula and numerous islands. It’s linked to nearby Sweden via the Öresund bridge.

Language: Danish • Capital: Copenhagen • Currency: Danish krone • Visa

🇩🇯 Djibouti

Djibouti, on the Horn of Africa, is a mostly French- and Arabic-speaking country of dry shrublands, volcanic formations and Gulf of Aden beaches.

Language: Arabic, French • Capital: Djibouti• Currency: Djiboutian franc • Visa

🇩🇲 Dominica

Dominica is a mountainous Caribbean island nation with natural hot springs and tropical rainforests. Morne Trois Pitons National Park is home to the volcanically heated, steam-covered Boiling Lake.

Language: English • Capital: Roseau• Currency: East Caribbean dollar • Visa

🇩🇴 Dominican Republic

The Dominican Republic is a Caribbean nation that shares the island of Hispaniola with Haiti to the west. It’s known for its beaches, resorts and golfing. Its terrain comprises rainforest, savannah, and highlands, including Pico Duarte, the Caribbean’s tallest mountain.

Language: Spanish • Capital: Santo Domingo • Currency: Dominican peso • Visa

E

🇪🇨 Ecuador

Ecuador is a country straddling the equator on South America’s west coast. Its diverse landscape encompasses the Amazon jungle, Andean highlands, and the wildlife-rich Galápagos Islands.

Language: Spanish, Quechua • Capital: Quito • Currency: United States dollar • Visa

🇪🇬 Egypt

Egypt, a country linking northeast Africa with the Middle East, dates to the time of the pharaohs. Millennia-old monuments sit along the fertile Nile River Valley, including Giza’s colossal Pyramids and Great Sphinx as well as Luxor’s hieroglyph-lined Karnak Temple and Valley of the Kings tombs.

Language: Arabic • Capital: Cairo • Currency: Egyptian pound • Visa

🇸🇻 El Salvador

El Salvador, officially the Republic of El Salvador, is the smallest and the most densely populated country in Central America.

Language: Spanish • Capital: San Salvador • Currency: United States dollar • Visa

🇬🇶 Equatorial Guinea

Equatorial Guinea is a Central African country comprising the Rio Muni mainland and 5 volcanic offshore islands.

Language: French, Portuguese, Spanish • Capital: Malabo • Currency: Central African CFA franc • Visa

🇪🇷 Eritrea

Eritrea is a northeast African country on the Red Sea coast. It shares borders with Ethiopia, Sudan, and Djibouti.

Language: Tigrinya • Capital: Asmara • Currency: Eritrean nakfa • Visa

🇪🇪 Estonia

Estonia, a country in Northern Europe, borders the Baltic Sea and Gulf of Finland. Including more than 1,500 islands, its diverse terrain spans rocky beaches, old-growth forest, and many lakes. Formerly part of the Soviet Union, it’s dotted with castles, churches and hilltop fortresses.

Language: Estonian • Capital: Tallinn • Currency: Euro • Visa

🇸🇿 Eswatini (formerly Swaziland)

Swaziland, a small, landlocked monarchy in southern Africa, is known for its wilderness reserves and festivals showcasing traditional Swazi culture.

Language: English, Swazi • Capital: Mbabane • Currency: Swazi lilangeni • Visa

🇪🇹 Ethiopia

Ethiopia, in the Horn of Africa, is a rugged, landlocked country split by the Great Rift Valley. With archaeological finds dating back more than 3 million years, it’s a place of ancient culture.

Language: Amharic • Capital: Addis Ababa• Currency: Ethiopian birr • Visa

F

🇫🇯 Fiji

Fiji, a country in the South Pacific, is an archipelago of more than 300 islands. It’s famed for rugged landscapes, palm-lined beaches and coral reefs with clear lagoons. Its major islands, Viti Levu and Vanua Levu, contain most of the population.

Language: English, Fijian, Fiji Hindi • Capital: Suva • Currency: Fijian dollar • Visa

🇫🇮 Finland

Finland is a Northern European nation bordering Sweden, Norway, and Russia. Its capital, Helsinki, occupies a peninsula and surrounding islands in the Baltic Sea.

Language: Finish, Swedish • Capital: Helsinki • Currency: Euro • Visa

🇫🇷 France

France, in Western Europe, encompasses medieval cities, alpine villages and Mediterranean beaches. Paris, its capital, is famed for its fashion houses, classical art museums including the Louvre and monuments like the Eiffel Tower.

Language: French • Capital: Paris • Currency: Euro • Visa

G

🇬🇦 Gabon

Gabon, a country along the Atlantic coast of Central Africa, has significant areas of protected parkland. The forested coastal terrain of its famed Loango National Park shelters a diversity of wildlife, from gorillas and hippos to whales.

Language: French • Capital: Libreville • Currency: Central African CFA franc • Visa

🇬🇲 Gambia

The Gambia is a small West African country, bounded by Senegal, with a narrow Atlantic coastline. It’s known for its diverse ecosystems around the central Gambia River.

Language: English • Capital: Banjul • Currency: Gambian dalasi • Visa

🇬🇪 Georgia

Georgia, a country at the intersection of Europe and Asia, is a former Soviet republic that’s home to Caucasus Mountain villages and Black Sea beaches. It’s famous for Vardzia, a sprawling cave monastery dating to the 12th century, and the ancient wine-growing region Kakheti.

Language: Georgian • Capital: Tbilisi • Currency: Georgian lari • Visa

🇩🇪 Germany

Germany is a Western European country with a landscape of forests, rivers, mountain ranges, and North Sea beaches. It has over 2 millennia of history.

Language: German • Capital: Berlin • Currency: Euro • Visa

🇬🇭 Ghana

Ghana, officially the Republic of Ghana, is a country located along the Gulf of Guinea and Atlantic Ocean, in the subregion of West Africa.

Language: English • Capital: Accra • Currency: Ghanaian cedi • Visa

🇬🇷 Greece

Greece is a country in southeastern Europe with thousands of islands throughout the Aegean and Ionian seas. Influential in ancient times, it’s often called the cradle of Western civilization.

Language: Greek • Capital: Athens • Currency: Euro • Visa

🇬🇩 Grenada

Grenada is a Caribbean country comprising a main island, also called Grenada, and smaller surrounding islands. Dubbed the “Spice Isle,” the hilly main island is home to numerous nutmeg plantations.

Language: English • Capital: Saint George • Currency: East Caribbean dollar • Visa

🇬🇹 Guatemala

Guatemala, a Central American country south of Mexico, is home to volcanoes, rainforests, and ancient Mayan sites. The capital, Guatemala City, features the stately National Palace of Culture and the National Museum of Archaeology and Ethnology.

Language: Spanish • Capital: Guatemala City • Currency: Guatemalan quetzal • Visa

🇬🇳 Guinea

Guinea is a country in West Africa, bordered on the west by the Atlantic Ocean. It’s known for the Mount Nimba Strict Nature Reserve, in the southeast. The reserve protects a forested mountain range rich in native plants and animals, including chimpanzees and the viviparous toad.

Language: French • Capital: Conakry • Currency: Guinean franc • Visa

🇬🇼 Guinea-Bissau

Guinea-Bissau is a tropical country on West Africa’s Atlantic coast that’s known for national parks and wildlife. The forested, sparsely populated Bijagós archipelago is a protected biosphere reserve.

Language: Portuguese • Capital: Bissau • Currency: West African CFA franc • Visa

🇬🇾 Guyana

Guyana, a country on South America’s North Atlantic coast, is defined by its dense rainforest. English-speaking, with cricket and calypso music, it’s culturally connected to the Caribbean region.

Language: English • Capital: Georgetown• Currency: Guyanese dollar • Visa

H

🇭🇹 Haiti

Haiti is a Caribbean country that shares the island of Hispaniola with the Dominican Republic to its east. Though it’s still recovering from a 2010 earthquake, many of Haiti’s landmarks dating to the early 19th century remain intact.

Language: French, Haitian Creole • Capital: Port-au-Prince • Currency: Haitian gourde • Visa

🇭🇳 Honduras

Honduras is a Central American country with Caribbean Sea coastlines to the north and the Pacific Ocean to the south. In the tropical rainforest near Guatemala, the ancient Mayan ceremonial site Copán has stone-carved hieroglyphics and stelae, tall stone monuments.

Language: Spanish • Capital: TEGUCIGALPA • Currency: Honduran lempira • Visa

🇭🇺 Hungary

Hungary is a landlocked country in Central Europe. Its capital, Budapest, is bisected by the Danube River. Its cityscape is studded with architectural landmarks from Buda’s medieval Castle Hill and grand neoclassical buildings along Pest’s Andrássy Avenue to the 19th-century Chain Bridge.

Language: Hungarian • Capital: Budapest • Currency: Hungarian forint • Visa

I

🇮🇸 Iceland

Iceland, a Nordic island nation, is defined by its dramatic landscape with volcanoes, geysers, hot springs, and lava fields. Massive glaciers are protected in Vatnajökull and Snæfellsjökull national parks.

Language: Icelandic • Capital: Reykjavík • Currency: Icelandic króna • Visa

🇮🇳 India

India, officially the Republic of India, is a country in South Asia. It is the seventh-largest country by area, the second-most populous country, and the most populous democracy in the world.

Language: Hindi, English • Capital: New Delhi • Currency: Indian rupee • Visa

🇮🇩 Indonesia

Indonesia, officially the Republic of Indonesia, is a country in Southeast Asia, between the Indian and Pacific oceans. It is the world’s largest island country, with more than seventeen thousand islands

Language: Indonesian • Capital: Jakarta • Currency: Indonesian rupiah • Visa

🇮🇷 Iran

Iran, also called Persia, and officially the Islamic Republic of Iran, is a country in Western Asia. With 82 million inhabitants, Iran is the world’s 18th most populous country.

Language: Persian • Capital: Tehran • Currency: Iranian rial • Visa

🇮🇶 Iraq

Iraq, officially the Republic of Iraq, is a country in Western Asia, bordered by Turkey to the north, Iran to the east, Kuwait to the southeast, Saudi Arabia to the south, Jordan to the southwest and Syria to the west.

Language: Arabic • Capital: Baghdad • Currency: Iraqi dinar • Visa

🇮🇪 Ireland

Ireland is an island in the North Atlantic. It is separated from Great Britain to its east by the North Channel, the Irish Sea, and St George’s Channel.

Language: English, Irish • Capital: Dublin • Currency: Euro • Visa

🇮🇱 Israel

Israel, a Middle Eastern country on the Mediterranean Sea, is regarded by Jews, Christians, and Muslims as the biblical Holy Land. Its most sacred sites are in Jerusalem. Within its Old City, the Temple Mount complex includes the Dome of the Rock shrine, the historic Western Wall, Al-Aqsa Mosque and the Church of the Holy Sepulchre.

Language: Hebrew • Capital: Jerusalem • Currency: Israeli new shekel • Visa

🇮🇹 Italy

Italy, a European country with a long Mediterranean coastline, has left a powerful mark on Western culture and cuisine. Its capital, Rome, is home to the Vatican as well as landmark art and ancient ruins.

Language: Italian • Capital: Rome • Currency: Euro • Visa

J

🇯🇲 Jamaica

Jamaica, a Caribbean island nation, has a lush topography of mountains, rainforests, and reef-lined beaches. Many of its all-inclusive resorts are clustered in Montego Bay, with its British-colonial architecture, and Negril, known for its diving and snorkeling sites.

Language: English • Capital: Kingston • Currency: Jamaican dollar • Visa

🇯🇵 Japan

Japan is an island country in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian continent and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and the Philippine Sea in the south.

Language: Japanese • Capital: Tokyo • Currency: Japanese yen • Visa

🇯🇴 Jordan

Jordan, an Arab nation on the east bank of the Jordan River, is defined by ancient monuments, nature reserves, and seaside resorts. It’s home to the famed archaeological site of Petra, the Nabatean capital dating to around 300 B.C.

Language: Arabic • Capital: Amman • Currency: Jordanian dinar • Visa

K

🇰🇿 Kazakhstan

Kazakhstan, a Central Asian country and former Soviet republic, extends from the Caspian Sea in the west to the Altai Mountains at its eastern border with China and Russia

Language: Russian • Capital: Astana • Currency: Kazakhstani tenge • Visa

🇰🇪 Kenya

Kenya is a country in East Africa with a coastline on the Indian Ocean. It encompasses savannah, lakelands, the dramatic Great Rift Valley and mountain highlands. It’s also home to wildlife like lions, elephants, and rhinos.

Language: English • Capital: Nairobi • Currency: Kenyan shilling • Visa

🇰🇮 Kiribati

Kiribati, officially the Republic of Kiribati, is a sovereign state in Micronesia in the central Pacific Ocean. The permanent population is just over 110,000, more than half of whom live on Tarawa Atoll.

Language: English • Capital: South Tarawa • Currency: Australian dollar • Visa

🇽🇰 Kosovo

Kosovo, officially the Republic of Kosovo, is a partially recognized state and disputed territory in Southeastern Europe.

Language: Albanian, Serbian • Capital: Pristina • Currency: Euro • Visa

🇰🇼 Kuwait

Kuwait, officially the State of Kuwait, is a country in Western Asia. Situated in the northern edge of Eastern Arabia at the tip of the Persian Gulf, it shares borders with Iraq and Saudi Arabia.

Language: Standard Arabic • Capital: Kuwait City • Currency: Kuwaiti dinar • Visa

🇰🇬 Kyrgyzstan

Kyrgyzstan, officially the Kyrgyz Republic, and also known as Kirghizia, is a country in Central Asia. Kyrgyzstan is a landlocked country with mountainous terrain.

Language: Russian • Capital: Bishkek • Currency: Kyrgyzstani som • Visa

L

🇱🇦 Laos

Laos is a Southeast Asian country traversed by the Mekong River and known for mountainous terrain, French colonial architecture, hill tribe settlements, and Buddhist monasteries.

Language: Lao • Capital: Vientiane • Currency: Lao kip • Visa

🇱🇻 Latvia

Latvia is a country on the Baltic Sea between Lithuania and Estonia. Its landscape is marked by wide beaches as well as dense, sprawling forests.

Language: Latvian • Capital: Riga • Currency: Euro • Visa

🇱🇧 Lebanon

Lebanon, officially known as the Lebanese Republic, is a country in Western Asia. It is bordered by Syria to the north and east and Israel to the south, while Cyprus is west across the Mediterranean Sea.

Language: Arabic • Capital: Beirut • Currency: Lebanese pound • Visa

🇱🇸 Lesotho

Lesotho, a high-altitude, landlocked kingdom encircled by South Africa, is crisscrossed by a network of rivers and mountain ranges including the 3,482m-high peak of Thabana Ntlenyana.

Language: English • Capital: Maseru • Currency: Lesotho loti • Visa

🇱🇷 Liberia

Liberia is a country in West Africa, bordering Sierra Leone, Guinea and Côte d’Ivoire. On the Atlantic coast, the capital city of Monrovia is home to the Liberia National Museum, with its exhibits on national culture and history.

Language: English • Capital: Monrovia• Currency: Liberian dollar • Visa

🇱🇾 Libya

Libya, officially the State of Libya, is a country in the Maghreb region in North Africa.

Language: Arabic • Capital: Tripoli • Currency: Libyan dinar • Visa

🇱🇮 Liechtenstein

Liechtenstein is a German-speaking, 25km-long principality between Austria and Switzerland. It’s known for its medieval castles, alpine landscapes, and villages linked by a network of trails.

Language: German • Capital: Vaduz • Currency: Swiss franc • Visa

🇱🇹 Lithuania

Lithuania is a country and the southernmost of Europe’s Baltic states, a former Soviet bloc nation bordering Poland, Latvia, and Belarus. Its capital, Vilnius, near Belarus’ border, is known for its medieval Old Town.

Language: Lithuanian • Capital: Vilnius • Currency: Euro • Visa

🇱🇺 Luxembourg

Luxembourg is a small European country, surrounded by Belgium, France, and Germany. It’s mostly rural, with dense Ardennes forest and nature parks in the north, rocky gorges of the Mullerthal region in the east and the Moselle river valley in the southeast.

Language: French, German • Capital: Luxembourg • Currency: Euro • Visa

🇲🇬 Madagascar

Madagascar, officially the Republic of Madagascar, and previously known as the Malagasy Republic, is an island country in the Indian Ocean, approximately 400 kilometers off the coast of East Africa.

Language: French, Malagasy • Capital: Antananarivo • Currency: Malagasy ariary • Visa

🇲🇼 Malawi

Malawi, a landlocked country in southeastern Africa, is defined by its topography of highlands split by the Great Rift Valley and enormous Lake Malawi.

Language: English, Chichewa • Capital: Lilongwe • Currency: Malawian kwacha • Visa

🇲🇾 Malaysia

Malaysia is a Southeast Asian country occupying parts of the Malay Peninsula and the island of Borneo. It’s known for its beaches, rainforests, and mix of Malay, Chinese, Indian and European cultural influences.

Language: Malay • Capital: Kuala Lumpur • Currency: Malaysian ringgit • Visa

🇲🇻 Maldives

The Maldives is a tropical nation in the Indian Ocean composed of 26 ring-shaped atolls, which are made up of more than 1,000 coral islands. It’s known for its beaches, blue lagoons, and extensive reefs.

Language: Dhivehi • Capital: Male • Currency: Maldivian rufiyaa • Visa

🇲🇱 Mali

Mali, officially the Republic of Mali, is a landlocked country in West Africa. Mali is the eighth-largest country in Africa, with an area of just over 1,240,000 square kilometers.

Language: French • Capital: Bamako • Currency: West African CFA franc • Visa

🇲🇹 Malta

Malta is an archipelago in the central Mediterranean between Sicily and the North African coast. It’s a nation known for historic sites related to a succession of rulers including the Romans, Moors, Knights of Saint John, French and British.

Language: English • Capital: Valletta • Currency: Euro • Visa

🇲🇭 Marshall Islands

The Marshall Islands are a sprawling chain of volcanic islands and coral atolls in the central Pacific Ocean, between Hawaii and the Philippines. In the northwest, Bikini Atoll’s largely undisturbed waters, used as a ship graveyard after World War II, are now a popular wreck dive site.

Language: English • Capital: Majuro • Currency: United States dollar • Visa

🇲🇷 Mauritania

Mauritania, officially the Islamic Republic of Mauritania, is a country in Northwest Africa. It is the eleventh largest sovereign state in Africa and is bordered by the Atlantic Ocean to the west

Language: Arabic • Capital: Nouakchott • Currency: Mauritanian ouguiya • Visa

🇲🇺 Mauritius

Mauritius, an Indian Ocean island nation, is known for its beaches, lagoons, and reefs. The mountainous interior includes Black River Gorges National Park, with rainforests, waterfalls, hiking trails and wildlife like the flying fox.

Language: English • Capital: Port Louis• Currency: Mauritian rupee • Visa

🇲🇽 Mexico

Mexico, officially the United Mexican States, is a country in the southern portion of North America.

Language: Spanish • Capital: Mexico City • Currency: Mexican peso • Visa

The Federated States of Micronesia is a country spread across the western Pacific Ocean comprising more than 600 islands. Micronesia is made up of 4 island states: Pohnpei, Kosrae, Chuuk, and Yap.

Language: Woleaian • Capital: Palikir• Currency: United States dollar • Visa

🇲🇩 Moldova

Moldova, an Eastern European country and former Soviet republic, has varied terrain including forests, rocky hills, and vineyards. Its wine regions include Nistreana, known for reds, and Codru, home to some of the world’s largest cellars.

Language: Romanian • Capital: Chisinau • Currency: Moldovan leu • Visa

🇲🇨 Monaco

Monaco, officially the Principality of Monaco, is a sovereign city-state, country, and microstate on the French Riviera in Western Europe. France borders the country on three sides while the other side borders the Mediterranean Sea.

Language: French • Capital: Monaco• Currency: Euro • Visa

🇲🇳 Mongolia

Mongolia, a nation bordered by China and Russia, is known for vast, rugged expanses and nomadic culture. Its capital, Ulaanbaatar, centers around Chinggis Khaan (Genghis Khan) Square, named for the notorious founder of the 13th- and 14th-century Mongol Empire.

Language: Mongolian • Capital: Ulaanbaatar • Currency: Mongolian tögrög • Visa

🇲🇪 Montenegro

Montenegro is a Balkan country with rugged mountains, medieval villages and a narrow strip of beaches along its Adriatic coastline. The Bay of Kotor, resembling a fjord, is dotted with coastal churches and fortified towns such as Kotor and Herceg Novi.

Language: Albanian, Croatian, Serbian • Capital: Podgorica • Currency: Euro • Visa

🇲🇦 Morocco

Morocco, a North African country bordering the Atlantic Ocean and Mediterranean Sea, is distinguished by its Berber, Arabian and European cultural influences. Marrakesh’s medina, a mazelike medieval quarter, offers entertainment in its Djemaa el-Fna square and souks (marketplaces) selling ceramics, jewelry, and metal lanterns.

Language: Arabic, Berber • Capital: Rabat • Currency: Moroccan dirham • Visa

🇲🇿 Mozambique

Mozambique is a southern African nation whose long Indian Ocean coastline is dotted with popular beaches like Tofo, as well as offshore marine parks. In the Quirimbas Archipelago, a 250km stretch of coral islands, mangrove-covered Ibo Island has colonial-era ruins surviving from a period of Portuguese rule.

Language: Portuguese • Capital: Maputo • Currency: Mozambican metical • Visa

🇲🇲 Myanmar (formerly Burma)

Myanmar (formerly Burma) is a Southeast Asian nation of more than 100 ethnic groups, bordering India, Bangladesh, China, Laos, and Thailand. Yangon (formerly Rangoon), the country’s largest city, is home to bustling markets, numerous parks and lakes, and the towering, gilded Shwedagon Pagoda, which contains Buddhist relics and dates to the 6th century.

Language: Burmese • Capital: Nay Pyi Taw • Currency: Burmese kyat • Visa

🇳🇦 Namibia

Namibia, is a country in southern Africa. It ranges from arid in the north to desert on the coast and in the east. The landscape is spectacular, but the desert, mountains, canyons, and savannas are perhaps better to see than to occupy.

Language: Oshiwambo • Capital: Windhoek • Currency: Namibian dollar

(NAD)• Visa

🇳🇷 Nauru

Nauru, is an island country in Micronesia, a subregion of Oceania, in the Central Pacific. Nauru is the third-smallest country in the world behind Vatican City, and Monaco, making it the smallest state in the South Pacific Ocean, the smallest state outside Europe, the smallest island state, and the smallest republic.

Language: Nauruan, English • Capital: Yaren • Currency: Australian dollar(AUD)• Visa

🇳🇵 Nepal

Nepal, is a landlocked country in South Asia. It is located mainly in the Himalayas, but also includes parts of the Indo-Gangetic Plain. Nepal has a diverse geography, including fertile plains, subalpine forested hills, and eight of the world’s ten tallest mountains, including Mount Everest, the highest point on Earth.

Language: Nepali • Capital: Kathmandu • Currency: Nepalese rupee (NPR)• Visa

🇳🇱 Netherlands

Netherlands, is a country in Northwestern Europe with some overseas territories in the Caribbean. The five largest cities in the Netherlands are Amsterdam, Rotterdam, The Hague, Utrecht, and Eindhoven. Amsterdam is the country’s capital, while The Hague holds the seat of the States General, Cabinet and Supreme Court. The Port of Rotterdam is the largest port in Europe, and the largest in any country outside Asia.

Language: Dutch • Capital: Amsterdam • Currency: Euro, US dollar • Visa

🇳🇿 New Zealand

New Zealand, is a sovereign island country in the southwestern Pacific Ocean. The country geographically comprises two main landmasses — the North Island, the South Island, and around 600 smaller islands. Because of its remoteness, it was one of the last lands to be settled by humans.

Language: English• Capital: Wellington • Currency: New Zealand dollar (NZD) • Visa

🇳🇮 Nicaragua

Nicaragua, is the largest country in the Central American isthmus. Managua is the country’s capital and largest city and is also the third-largest city in Central America, behind Tegucigalpa and Guatemala City. The multi-ethnic population of six million includes people of indigenous, European, African, and Asian heritage.

Language: Spanish • Capital: Managua • Currency: Córdoba (NIO) • Visa

🇳🇪 Niger

Niger, is a landlocked western African country named after the Niger River. Over 80% of its land area lies in the Sahara Desert .It the largest country in West Africa.

Language: French • Capital: Niamey • Currency: West African CFA franc (XOF) • Visa

🇳🇬 Nigeria

Nigeria, is a country located on the western coast of Africa. Nigeria has a diversegeography, with climates ranging from arid to humid equatorial. However, Nigeria’s most diverse feature is its people. Hundreds of languages are spoken in the country

Language: English • Capital: Abuja • Currency: Naira (NGN)• Visa

🇰🇵 North Korea

North Korea, is a country in East Asia constituting the northern part of the Korean Peninsula, with Pyongyang the capital and the largest city in the country.

Language: Korean • Capital: Pyongyang • Currency: Korean People’s won (KPW) • Visa

🇲🇰 North Macedonia (formerly Macedonia)

North Macedonia, is a country of the south-central Balkans. It constitutes approximately the northern third of the larger geographical region of Macedonia, and is defined primarily by mountains, valleys, and rivers.

Language: Macedonian, Albanian • Capital: Skopje • Currency: Macedonian denar(MKD) • Visa

🇳🇴 Norway

Norway, is a country of northern Europe that occupies the western half of the Scandinavian peninsula. Nearly half of the inhabitants of the country live in the far south, in the region around Oslo, the capital. About two-thirds of Norway is mountainous, and off its much-indented coastline lie, carved by deep glacial fjords, some 50,000 islands.

Language: Norwegian, Sámi • Capital: Oslo • Currency: Norwegian krone (NOK) • Visa

🇴🇲 Oman

Oman, is an Arabcountry on the southeastern coast of the Arabian Peninsula in Western Asia. The coast is formed by the Arabian Sea on the southeast and the Gulf of Oman on the northeast. The capital, Muscat, lies along the northern coast. Blending modern and traditional architecture, the city commands a view of the Gulf of Oman and serves as a port and commercial centre.

Language: Arabic • Capital: Muscat • Currency: Rial (OMR) • Visa

🇵🇰 Pakistan

Pakistan, is a country in South Asia. It is the world’s sixth-most populous country. Its capital is Islamabad, in the foothills of the Himalayas in the northern part of the country, and its largest city is Karachi, in the south on the coast of the Arabian Sea.

Language: English, Urdu • Capital: Islamabad • Currency: Pakistani rupee (PKR) • Visa

🇵🇼 Palau

Palau, is an island country located in the western Pacific Ocean. The country contains approximately 340 islands, forming the western chain of the Caroline Islands in Micronesia.The most populous island is Koror.

Language: Palauan, English • Capital: Ngerulmud • Currency: United States dollar(USD)• Visa

🇵🇸 Palestine

Palestine, is a de jure sovereign state in Western Asia claiming the West Bank and Gaza Strip with East Jerusalem as the designated capital, although its administrative center is currently located in Ramallah.The State of Palestine is recognized by 137 UN members and since 2012 has a status of a non-member observer state in the UN — which implies recognition of statehood.

Language: Arabic • Capital: Ramallah, Jerusalem • Currency: Israeli new shekel (ILS)• Visa

🇵🇦 Panama

Panama, is a country of Central America located on the Isthmus of Panama, the narrow bridge of land that connects North and South America. Covering around 40 percent of its land area, Panama’s jungles are home to an abundance of tropical plants and animals — some of them found nowhere else on earth.

Language: Spanish • Capital: Panama City • Currency: Balboa (PAB), United States dollar (USD) • Visa

🇵🇬 Papua New Guinea

Papua New Guinea, is a country in Oceania that occupies the eastern half of the island of New Guinea and its offshore islands in Melanesia, a region of the southwestern Pacific Ocean north of Australia. It is the world’s 3rd largest island country.

Language: Enga, Melpa, Huli • Capital: Port Moresby • Currency: Papua New Guinean kina(PGK) • Visa

🇵🇾 Paraguay

Paraguay, is a country in South America. Paraguay has a more-homogeneous population than most other countries in South America; most Paraguayans are of European and Guaraní ancestry.

Language: Spanish, Guarani • Capital: Asunción • Currency: Guaraní (PYG) • Visa

🇵🇪 Peru

Peru, is a country in western South America. Peru is essentially a tropical country, with its northern tip nearly touching the Equator. Despite its tropical location, a great diversity of climate, of way of life, and of economic activity is brought about by the extremes of elevation and by the southwest winds that sweep in across the cold Peru Current, which flows along its Pacific shoreline.

Language: Spanish • Capital: Lima • Currency: Sol (PEN) • Visa

🇵🇭 Philippines

Philippines, island country of Southeast Asia in the western Pacific Ocean. Manila is the capital, but nearby Quezon City is the country’s most populous city.

Language: Filipino, English • Capital: Manila • Currency: Peso(PHP) • Visa

🇵🇱 Poland

Poland, is a country located in Central Europe. It is the sixth most populous member state of the European Union. Poland is located at a geographic crossroads that links the forested lands of northwestern Europe to the sea lanes of the Atlantic Ocean and the fertile plains of the Eurasian frontier.

Language: Polish • Capital: Warsaw • Currency: Polish zloty (PLN) • Visa

🇵🇹 Portugal

Portugal, is a country located mostly on the Iberian Peninsula in southwestern Europe. It is the westernmost sovereign state of mainland Europe, being bordered to the west and south by the Atlantic Ocean and to the north and east by Spain.

Language: Portuguese • Capital: Lisbon • Currency: Euro (EUR)• Visa

🇶🇦 Qatar

Qatar, is a country located in Western Asia, occupying the small Qatar Peninsula on the northeastern coast of the Arabian Peninsula. Because of its oil wealth, the country’s residents enjoy a high standard of living and a well-established system of social services.

Language: Arabic • Capital: Doha • Currency: Riyal (QAR)• Visa

🇷🇴 Romania

Romania, is a country located at the crossroads of Central, Eastern, and Southeastern Europe. Romania enjoys a considerable wealth of natural resources: fertile land for agriculture; pastures for livestock; forests that provide hard and soft woods; petroleum reserves; metals, including gold and silver in the Apuseni Mountains; numerous rivers that supply hydroelectricity; and a Black Sea coastline that is the site of both ports and resorts.

Language: Romanian • Capital: Bucharest • Currency: Romanian Leu (RON)• Visa

🇷🇺 Russia

Russia, is a transcontinental country in Eastern Europe and North Asia. It is, by a considerable margin, the largest country in the world by area, covering more than one-eighth of the Earth’s inhabited land area. Russia’s capital, Moscow, is one of the largest cities in the world and the largest city in Europe.

Language: Russian • Capital: Moscow • Currency: Russian ruble (RUB)• Visa

🇷🇼 Rwanda

Rwanda, is a country in Central Africa and one of the smallest countries on the African mainland. Rwanda is in the African Great Lakes region and is highly elevated; its geography is dominated by mountains in the west and savanna to the east, with numerous lakes throughout the country.

🇰🇳 Saint Kitts and Nevis

Saint Kitts and Nevis, is an island country in the West Indies. Located in the Leeward Islands chain of the Lesser Antilles, it is the smallest sovereign state in the Western Hemisphere, in both area and population. The country is a Commonwealth realm, with Elizabeth II as queen and head of state.

Language: English • Capital: Basseterre • Currency: East Caribbean dollar(XCD)• Visa

Saint Lucia is a sovereign island country in the West Indies in the eastern Caribbean Sea on the boundary with the Atlantic Ocean.

Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, is an Anglo-Caribbean country in the Lesser Antilles island arc, in the southern portion of the Windward Islands, which lies in the West Indies at the southern end of the eastern border of the Caribbean Sea where the latter meets the Atlantic Ocean.

🇼🇸 Samoa

Samoa, country in the central South Pacific Ocean consisting of two main islands, Savai’i and Upolu, and four smaller islands (Manono, Apolima, Fanuatapu, and Namua).

🇸🇲 San Marino

San Marino, is an enclaved microstate in Southern Europe, on the northeastern side of the Apennine Mountains, completely surrounded by Italy. It is the third smallest country in Europe, after Vatican City and Monaco, and the fifth smallest country in the world.

Language: Italian • Capital: San Marino • Currency: Euro (EUR)• Visa

🇸🇹 Sao Tome and Principe

Sao Tome and Principe, is an island country in the Gulf of Guinea, off the western equatorial coast of Central Africa. São Tomé and Príncipe is the second-smallest African sovereign state after Seychelles, as well as the smallest Portuguese-speaking country.

🇸🇦 Saudi Arabia

Saudi Arabia is a country in Western Asia constituting the bulk of the Arabian Peninsula. Arabia is geographically the largest sovereign state in the Middle East, the second-largest in the Arab world (after Algeria), the fifth-largest in Asia, and the 12th-largest in the world.

Language: Arabic • Capital: Riyadh • Currency: Saudi riyal (SAR)• Visa

🇸🇳 Senegal

Senegal, country in western Africa. Located at the westernmost point of the continent and served by multiple air and maritime travel routes, Senegal is known as the “Gateway to Africa.” Senegal’s economic and political capital is Dakar.

Serbia, country in the west-central Balkans. For most of the 20th century, it was a part of Yugoslavia. Its capital, Belgrade, ranks among the longest inhabited and largest citiеs in southeastern Europe.

🇸🇨 Seychelles

Seychelles, island republic in the western Indian Ocean, comprising about 115 islands, with lush tropical vegetation, beautiful beaches, and a wide variety of marine life.The capital, Victoria, is situated on the island of Mahé.

Seychellois rupee(SCR) • Visa

🇸🇱 Sierra Leone

Sierra Leone, country of western Africa. The capital, Freetown, commands one of the world’s largest natural harbours. Bo is the second-largest city in the country and is located 150 miles from Freetown.

🇸🇬 Singapore

Singapore, city-state located at the southern tip of the Malay Peninsula. It consists of the diamond-shaped Singapore Island and some 60 small islets; the main island occupies all but about 18 square miles of this combined area. Singapore is the largest port in Southeast Asia and one of the busiest in the world.

🇸🇰 Slovakia

Slovakia, landlocked country of central Europe. The capital and largest city is Bratislava, and the second-largest city is Košice. The official language is Slovak.

Euro (EUR)• Visa

🇸🇮 Slovenia

Slovenia, country in central Europe that was part of Yugoslavia for most of the 20th century. The capital and largest city is Ljubljana. Over half of the territory is covered by forest. The human settlement of Slovenia is dispersed and uneven.

Language: Slovene • Capital: Ljubljana • Currency: Euro (EUR) • Visa

🇸🇧 Solomon Islands

Solomon Islands, country in the southwestern Pacific Ocean. It consists of a double chain of volcanic islands and coral atolls in Melanesia. Honiara, on the north coast of Guadalcanal Island, is Solomon Islands’ capital and largest city.

Language: English • Capital: Honiara • Currency:

Solomon Islands dollar(SBD) • Visa

🇸🇴 Somalia

Somalia, easternmost country of Africa, on the Horn of Africa. The capital, Mogadishu, is located just north of the Equator on the Indian Ocean. Somalia has the longest coastline on Africa’s mainland, and its terrain consists mainly of plateaus, plains and highlands.

Language: Somali, Arabic • Capital: Mogadishu • Currency:

Somali shilling (SOS) • Visa

South Africa, the southernmost country in Africa. South Africa is the largest country in Southern Africa and the 24th-largest country in the world by land area. South Africa has three cities that serve as capitals.

South Korea, country in East Asia. South Korea makes up about 45 percent of the peninsula’s land area. Its capital, Seoul, is a major global city and half of South Korea’s over 51 million people live in the Seoul Capital Area, the fourth-largest metropolitan economy in the world.

Language: Korean • Capital: Seoul• Currency: Korean Republic won (KRW)• Visa

🇸🇸 South Sudan

South Sudan, country located in northeastern Africa. Its capital and largest city is Juba. It gained independence from the Republic of the Sudan in 2011, making it the most recent sovereign state with widespread recognition.

🇪🇸 Spain

Spain, country located in extreme southwestern Europe. It occupies about 85 percent of the Iberian Peninsula, which it shares with its smaller neighbour Portugal. Spain’s capital and largest city is Madrid; other major urban areas include Barcelona, Valencia, Seville, Malaga, and Bilbao.

🇱🇰 Sri Lanka

Sri Lanka, formerly Ceylon, island country lying in the Indian Ocean and separated from peninsular India by the Palk Strait. The legislative capital, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte, is a suburb of the commercial capital and largest city, Colombo.

Sudan, country located in northeastern Africa. Sudan’s predominant religion is Islam, and its official languages are Arabic and English. The capital is Khartoum, located at the confluence of the Blue and White Nile.

🇸🇷 Suriname

Suriname, country located on the northern coast of South America. Suriname is one of the smallest countries in South America, yet its population is one of the most ethnically diverse in the region. The capital and largest city is Paramaribo.

Sweden, country located on the Scandinavian Peninsula in northern Europe. Sweden is the largest country in Northern Europe, the third-largest country in the European Union and the fifth largest country in Europe by area. The capital city is Stockholm.

Switzerland, federated country of central Europe. Switzerland’s administrative capital is Bern, while Lausanne serves as its judicial centre. Syria, country located on the east coast of the Mediterranean Sea in southwestern Asia. Aleppo and the capital city Damascus are among the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world.

Taiwan, island in the western Pacific Ocean that lies roughly 100 miles off the coast of southeastern China. Taipei is the capital and largest metropolitan area. Other major cities include Kaohsiung, Taichung, Tainan and Taoyuan.

Tanzania, East African country situated just south of the Equator. Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa’s highest mountain, is in northeastern Tanzania.

Thailand, country located in the center of mainland Southeast Asia. Thailand is the world’s 50th-largest country by total area and the 21st-most-populous country. The capital and largest city is Bangkok, a special administrative area.

Timor-Leste, island country in the eastern Lesser Sunda Islands, at the southern extreme of the Malay Archipelago. It occupies the eastern half of the island of Timor. Dili is the capital and largest city.

Togo, country of western Africa. Lomé, the capital, is situated in the southwest of the country and is the largest city and port. While the official language is French, many other languages are spoken, particularly those of the Gbe family.

Tonga is a Polynesian sovereign state and archipelago comprising 169 islands, of which 36 are inhabited. The capital, Nukuʿalofa, is on the island of Tongatapu. Tonga is a member of the Commonwealth and of the United Nations.

Trinidad and Tobago, island country of the southeastern West Indies. It consists of two main islands — Trinidad and Tobago — and several smaller islands. The capital of Trinidad and Tobago is Port of Spain, located on the northwestern coast of Trinidad.

🇹🇳 Tunisia

Tunisia, country of North Africa. Tunisia’s accessible Mediterranean Sea coastline and strategic location have attracted conquerors and visitors throughout the ages. Tunisia’s name is derived from its capital city, Tunis, which is located on its northeast coast.

🇹🇷 Turkey

Turkey, country that occupies a unique geographic position, lying partly in Asia and partly in Europe. It is among the larger countries of the region in terms of territory and population, and its land area is greater than that of any European state.

Turkmenistan, country of Central Asia. It is the second-largest state in Central Asia, after Kazakhstan, and is the southernmost of the region’s five republics. After Kazakhstan, Turkmenistan is the least densely populated of the Central Asian states.

Tuvalu, formerly Ellice Islands, country in the west-central Pacific Ocean. It is composed of nine small coral islands scattered in a chain. The de facto capital is the village of Vaiaku, where most government offices are located.

Uganda, country in east-central Africa. About the size of Great Britain, Uganda is populated by dozens of ethnic groups. The English language and Christianity help unite these diverse peoples, who come together in the cosmopolitan capital of Kampala.

Ukraine, country located in eastern Europe, the second largest on the continent after Russia. The capital is Kiev, located on the Dnieper River in north-central Ukraine. Excluding Crimea, Ukraine has a population of about 42 million, making it the 32nd most populous country in the world.

Language: Ukrainian • Capital: Kiev • Currency: Ukrainian hryvnia (UAH) • Visa

🇦🇪 United Arab Emirates (UAE)

United Arab Emirates is a country in Western Asia at the southeast end of the Arabian Peninsula on the Persian Gulf, bordering Oman to the east and Saudi Arabia to the south and west, as well as sharing maritime borders with Qatar to the west and Iran to the north.

Language: Arabic • Capital: Abu Dhabi • Currency: UAE dirham (AED)• Visa

🇬🇧 United Kingdom (UK)

United Kingdom, island country located off the northwestern coast of mainland Europe. The United Kingdom comprises the whole of the island of Great Britain — which contains England, Wales, and Scotland — as well as the northern portion of the island of Ireland. The capital is London, which is among the world’s leading commercial, financial, and cultural centers.

Language: English, Welsh, Irish, Scottish Gaelic • Capital: London • Currency: Pound sterling (GBP)• Visa

🇺🇸 United States of America (USA)

United States of America, country in North America, a federal republic of 50 states. Besides the 48 conterminous states that occupy the middle latitudes of the continent, the United States includes the state of Alaska, at the northwestern extreme of North America, and the island state of Hawaii, in the mid-Pacific Ocean. The United States is the fourth largest country in the world.

Language: English • Capital: Washington, D.C. • Currency: United States dollar (USD)• Visa

🇺🇾 Uruguay

Uruguay, country located on the southeastern coast of South America. The second smallest country on the continent, Uruguay has long been overshadowed politically and economically by the adjacent republics of Brazil and Argentina, with both of which it shares many cultural and historical similarities.

Language: Spanish, Uruguayan Portuguese • Capital: Montevideo • Currency: Uruguayan peso (UYU) • Visa

🇺🇿 Uzbekistan

Uzbekistan, country in Central Asia. It lies mainly between two major rivers, the Syr Darya to the northeast and the Amu Darya to the southwest, though they only partly form its boundaries. Uzbekistan declared its independence from the Soviet Union on August 31, 1991. The capital is Tashkent (Toshkent).

Language: Uzbek • Capital: Tashkent • Currency: Uzbek som (UZS)• Visa

V

🇻🇺 Vanuatu

Vanuatu is a Pacific island country located in the South Pacific Ocean. It is consisting of a chain of 13 principal and many smaller islands located about 500 miles west of Fiji and 1,100 miles east of Australia. The nation’s largest towns are the capital Port Vila, on Efate, and Luganville on Espiritu Santo.

Language: Bislama, English, French • Capital: Port Vila • Currency: Vanuatu vatu (VUV) • Visa

🇻🇦 Vatican City

Vatican City is an independent city-state enclaved within Rome, Italy. It is the smallest sovereign state in the world by both area and population. The Vatican City is an ecclesiastical or sacerdotal-monarchical state (a type of theocracy) ruled by the pope who is the bishop of Rome and head of the Roman Catholic Church.

Language: Italian • Capital: Vatican City • Currency: Euro (EUR)• Visa

🇻🇪 Venezuela

Venezuela, country located at the northern end of South America. It occupies a roughly triangular area that is larger than the combined areas of France and Germany. The national capital, Caracas, is Venezuela’s primary center of industry, commerce, education, and tourism.

Language: Spanish, Wayuu, Warao• Capital: Caracas • Currency: Petro Bolívar Soberano (VES) • Visa

🇻🇳 Vietnam

Vietnam, country occupying the eastern portion of mainland Southeast Asia. It is the 15th most populous country in the world. Vietnam shares its land borders with China to the north, and Laos and Cambodia to the west. Its capital city is Hanoi, while its most populous city is Ho Chi Minh City.

Language: Vietnamese • Capital: Hanoi • Currency: đồng (VND) • Visa

Y

🇾🇪 Yemen

Yemen is located at the southern end of the Arabian Peninsula and is the second-largest country in the peninsula. It is bordered by Saudi Arabia to the north, the Red Sea to the west, the Gulf of Aden and Arabian Sea to the south, and Oman to the east-northeast.

Language: Arabic • Capital: Sana’a • Currency: Yemeni rial (YER)• Visa

Z

🇿🇲 Zambia

Zambia, landlocked country in Africa. It is situated on a high plateau in south-central Africa and takes its name from the Zambezi River, which drains all but a small northern part of the country.

Language: English, Bemba, Nyanja • Capital: Lusaka • Currency: Zambian kwacha (ZMW) • Visa

🇿🇼 Zimbabwe

Zimbabwe is a landlocked country located in southern Africa, between the Zambezi and Limpopo Rivers, bordered by South Africa, Botswana, Zambia and Mozambique.
